subject: Instructions for clearing the pending undisputed payments of Consultants & Contractors/ Concessionaires and ensuring timely release of payments in future.
text: Hry <7efty <THf gfaarut 74 / Phone : 91-11-25074100/25074200 (asm waav &r <oTri FAT4) Y44 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 0-5 W 6, #aer-10, ERA; 7f facrit 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI Policy Guidelines/ Consultants/2o19 No. 9.2.28/2019 Dated the October , 2019 [Decision taken on File No. NHAI/11041/280/2018/Coord:] Sub: Instructions for clearing the pending undisputed payments of Consultants & Contractors/ Concessionaires and ensuring timely release of payments in future. Complaints have been received by Chairman/ Members from various stakeholders (Consultants & Contractors/ Concessionaires) about non-payment of their undisputed payments/ bills The matter has been viewed very seriously by Chairman: Accordingly, the following instructions are issued for strict compliance: (i) All ROs/ PDs are directed to ensure payment of undisputed claims/bills, as per the contractual provisions, within next 5 working days from the date of issue of this circular and give a confirmation in this regard to Member concerned: In case of any hurdle, the same shall be brought to the notice of Member concerned immediately. In future, the bills received will be tracked datewise alongwith date of payment by suitably modifying the Bill Tracking System and action will be taken o the concerned for delays in making payments, without valid reasons. (ii) As instances have come to the notice that the payments are getting delayed for want of revised sanction of project expenditure/ budget, the last date for getting revised sanction / budget has been extended upto 30.11.2019 so that the pending  payments are cleared: Further , CGM(T) concerned at HQ and CGM(F) , Shri  Madhup Kumar are designated as Nodal Officers for resolving all sanction/ budget   related matters before 30.11.2019. It is their  personal responsibility to issue the revised sanction/ budget, duly getting the orders of CA, if required, on the files by hand. (iii) The guidelines for timely processing of EOT cases in Consultancy Contracts were issued vide Policy Circular (Tech/155/2014) dated 09.05.2014 and the revised Delegation of Powers Were notified vide Policy Guidelines (18.24/2017) dated 21.08.2017 . Despite these guidelines, delays are   still   occurring in approval of EOTs of Consultants resulting thereby in non payment of amounts due to them, which are billed as per actuals by them: Therefore, the following decisions have been taken: Lr 'M T tM NHAL 22nd
